headline: LUCKHURST: Manchester United agree new contract with goalkeeper
body: Tom Heaton has agreed a new one-year contract with Manchester United.
United confirmed last week that Heaton, 39, was in discussions about a renewal and the goalkeeper is expected to sign his new deal this week.

Academy graduate Heaton rejoined United in 2021 under the assumption he would be the number two to Dean Henderson, whom then-manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer had planned to install as the first-choice 'keeper.

However, Henderson contracted Covid-19 in pre-season and was laid low for two months, which allowed David de Gea to continue in goal. After Henderson recovered, he was second choice to De Gea with Heaton third in the pecking order.

Heaton, who permanently left United for Cardiff City in 2010, made his debut against Young Boys in the Champions League group stage in December 2021 and he started twice under Erik ten Hag against Charlton Athletic and Nottingham Forest in the League Cup.

Andre Onana is expected to stay at United but there is uncertainty over the future of back-up goalie Altay Bayindir. The Turkey international moved to United from Fenerbahce in September 2023 and has played 11 times.
United scouted goalkeepers in the run up to the summer transfer window and could move for a more competitive 'keeper to challenge Onana.

headline: LUCKHURST: Manchester United football leadership member to leave for Everton
body: Nick Cox is to step down as the head of Manchester United's academy after six years and is set to take over as Everton's technical director.

Cox joined United in 2016 and stepped up to lead their academy in 2019. Under Cox's guidance, United won the FA Youth Cup in 2022, recruited Alejandro Garnacho from Atletico Madrid and Kobbie Mainoo emerged into the first team. Ethan Wheatley became United's 250th academy graduate when he came on against Sheffield United in April 2024.
Everton have headhunted Cox as part of their restructuring under new owners the Friedkin Group. Angus Kinnear was appointed the club's new chief executive last month.

United sources say Cox rejected various technical director and sporting director roles in the past. Cox will remain at the club for the coming months to ensure there is a smooth transition and a succession play is already underway.

Since Cox was chosen to run the academy over Nicky Butt, 27 academy players have made their debut for the United first team. Garnacho and Mainoo scored in the 2-1 FA Cup final victory over Manchester City last year.

Cox held video calls with Garnacho and his family to convince him to relocate from Madrid to Manchester at the age of 16 in 2020. United also recruited Alvaro Fernandez and Willy Kambwala that year. The pair were sold to Benfica and Villarreal last summer.
Other notable academy recruits during Cox's time include Harry Amass, Chido Obi and Darren Fletcher's twin sons, Jack and Tyler.
United had gone 11 years without winning the Youth Cup until they defeated Nottingham Forest in the 2022 final at Old Trafford, where a record crowd of 67,492 for the competition was in attendance.

Staff at United credit Cox with implementing enhancements in processes and culture that have raised the standards of an academy that had stagnated in the years after Sir Alex Ferguson retired in 2013. Following Brian McClair's departure as academy head, it was jointly run by John Murtough and former club secretary John Alexander in 2015.
After Cox received the director of academy title in 2022, he also became a member of United's clandestine football leadership group.
Four academy players recruited or nurtured during Cox's tenure were in the United squad for the Europa League final defeat to Tottenham Hotspur last month.

headline: Man United transfer news LIVE - 'Agreement' reached, Gyokeres latest, Sancho decision
body: Hello and welcome back to the Manchester United transfer blog on Wednesday, June 18.

The summer transfer window is back up and running with clubs now able to go about their business freely again until the market closes for good on Monday, September 1. United have plenty of business to do both this week, and in the weeks to come.

The club's top priority will be to bring Bryan Mbeumo to Old Trafford amid ongoing negotiations with the Reds, having already spent big to bring in Matheus Cunha. Tottenham Hotspur have also shown an interest the Brentford forward following the appointment of his former head coach at the Bees, Thomas Frank, and the Cameroonian has given an update on his future.
United however, will also have to sanction a number of departures in order to restore their place at England's top table, with the club already walking a tightrope in their battle with PSR.
All United players are available to be sold in the summer window, for the right price, and thus Alejandro Garnacho, Antony and Marcus Rashford all have suitors chasing their services.
Keep across the United transfer updates in our blog below:
Sport Bild claims Manchester United, Tottenham Hotspur, Newcastle United and Arsenal are the main players in the race to sign Xavi Simons this summer.
The German outlet claims that the Premier League quartet are all interested in signing the Dutch playmaker who scored 11 goals and notched eight assists in 33 games for RB Leipzig last season.
However, Simons has a reported €70m (£59.8m) asking price. That being said, the report claims the player's brother Faustino has been in talks with the Premier League clubs, along with Barcelona.
Given how much United could spend on Bryan Mbeumo and Matheus Cunha, another big-money signing looks unrealistic.

BILD have reported that Arsenal have 'reached an agreement' with RB Leipzig striker Benjamin Sesko. The 22-year-old has been the Gunners' top target this summer on the back of scoring 21 goals last season.

The report in Germany claims that the Gunners have come to an agreement with the Slovenian on personal terms. There is still work to be done with Leipzig but it's suggested that the north Londoners have signalled they will make an offer that won't be below their £85.5m valuation.
GiveMeSport claims Manchester United will rival Nottingham Forest for the signing of 25-year-old Palmeiras midfielder Richard Rios
The midfielder has a reported release clause of around £85m and Nuno Espirito Santo's side are said to have scouting the Colombian international who is in action at the Club World Cup.
It's not the first time United have been linked with a move for the midfielder, having been tipped to make a move for him back in 2024, while Spurs are also said to be keen.
Transfer intermediary, Vincenzo Morabito, has told Manchester United they need to lower their asking price for Jadon Sancho this summer amid a reported interest from Italy and Saudi Arabia.

United looked to have agreed a permanent departure for the England international last summer, agreed a loan deal with Chelsea which included an obligation to buy. However, the Blues look set to pay a reported £5m break clause and pass up on his transfer.
It means United will have to offload the winger elsewhere with a reported £21.4m asking price on his head attracting interest from the likes of Napoli.
Morabito told Radio CRC: "Ruben Amorim has made it very clear he does not want Sancho or Marcus Rashford in pre-season training.
"Manchester United are going to have to lower their expectations for Sancho, because they cannot ask for €25m for a player who has one year left on his contract and earns €18m per season wages.

"This operation is feasible, but we need to see how tough Manchester United can be holding out here, because Sancho is a good player and did pretty well at Chelsea. Cristiano Giuntoli wanted to bring him to Juventus last year, but then it didn’t go through."

The Sun claims that Manchester United have joined Roma and Napoli in the race to sign Nottingham Forest star Callum Hudson-Odoi. The 24-year-old played a key part in helping the Tricky Trees qualify for European football with five goals and three assists last season.

However, the former Chelsea man is approaching the final year of his contract with the trio of clubs keen on his signature this summer. The report claims Forest have opened contract talks after Manchester United's January enquiries were rebuffed with a firm "no."

United are still said to be keeping a close eye on developments at the City Ground, with the two Serie A giants also keen. If Napoli were to sign the England youth international, then it would likely rule out a move for United star Alejandro Garnacho after January interest from Antonio Conte's side.

Manchester United were one of the more active Premier League clubs during the first part of the summer transfer window and will be looking to ramp up their business and strengthen Ruben Amorim's squad ahead of next season.
With that in mind, here are some of your Reds headlines this morning on Wednesday, June 18:

Manchester United have been linked with a whole host of strikers this summer as they look to solve their goal scoring woes. Viktor Gyokeres, Victor Osimhen and Hugo Ekitike have all been tipped for a move to Old Trafford.
Using DataMB's player similarity generator tool to bring up players with similar characteristics to Ekitike, one option that emerged was Bayer Leverkusen forward Victor Boniface.
The Nigerian international joined the German side two years ago from Belgian side Union SG and made an immediate impact at the BayArena.

Despite picking up a major injury midway through his first season, his 21 goals and 10 assists helped Bayer on their way to winning the Bundesliga and DFB Pokal, as well as reaching the Europa League final.
He backed that up with 11 goals this season while sharing game time with Patrik Shick and, still just aged 24, he has his best years ahead of him.
Newly appointed Real Madrid manager Xabi Alonso is a huge fan of Boniface and he is said to be available £42.7million this summer.
You can read more here.
Hello and welcome back to another day of Manchester United news and transfers.
We'll be bringing you the latest from Old Trafford throughout the day and with the window now reopen, all eyes will be on Ruben Amorim's summer rebuild.
United are one of several clubs said to be interested in Malick Fofana.

L'Equipe claims Chelsea have enquired with Lyon about the winger, while Liverpool are another Premier League team linked. However, the French club reputedly have an asking price of over €50million (£43million), more than they sold Rayan Cherki to Manchester City.
United are reportedly one of as many as ten clubs scouting Richard Rios at the Club World Cup.

GiveMeSport claims Nottingham Forest and Tottenham Hotspur are two teams interested in the Palmeiras player. CaughtOffside have previously stated it is their understanding that the midfielder has a €100m release clause, which the Brazilian club want to be paid in full.
Caykur Rizespor reportedly have shown interest in Altay Bayindir after United put the goalkeeper 'on their sale list'.

Fotomac reports that the manager has contacted representatives of Turkey's big four teams - Besiktas, Fenerbahce, Galatasaray and Trabzonspor. However, the feedback received is said to have been negative.

Bayindir, however, would reputedly rather remain in Europe than return to Turkey with a team outside of the top four. United signed the player from Fenerbahce, but he previously played for Ankaragucu.
Pervis Estupinan reputedly wants to leave Brighton & Hove Albion and sign for United this summer.
The club's former chief scout, Mick Brown, has told Football Insider:

His agent has been making his availability known to a number of clubs, and from what I hear, he wants to join Man United. I think he's a decent player, but I don't think it's going to be a priority for them. Luke Shaw has got back to full fitness, and they're hopeful he can stay fit; they bought [Patrick] Dorgu in January, and they've got Harry Amass coming through as well.

Their priorities are at centre-forward and in midfield, so I don't expect them to move for Estupinan. He's a player they wanted previously, and I'm sure he's still got admirers, but unfortunately for him, they look to have moved on.
Ethan Wheatley scored for England this evening to help them come from 5-1 down to draw 5-5 with Germany at the European Under-19 Championship.

The teenage United striker scored soon after Said El Mala made it five early in the second half. Barely ten minutes later, the Young Lions were level, with Reiss-Alexander Russel-Denny, Zach Abbott and Jesse Derry scoring to salvage a point in Bucharest, Romania.
United have reportedly held talks over signing Roony Bardghji.

TBR Football claims the Copenhagen player is due to leave this summer with mere months remaining on his contract that expires on New Year's Eve. Aston Villa, Benfica, Borussia Dortmund, Marseille, Newcastle United, Porto, RB Leipzig and Tottenham Hotspur are also said to have discussed a deal for Bardghji.
United have reportedly held talks with the representatives of Juventus centre-forward Dusan Vlahovic.

FootballTransfers claims the player's camp approached United as their client is reputedly keen to make a dream move to the Premier League this summer transfer window. Their recent discussions are said to have been 'positive and constructive.'
The former Chelsea player Florent Malouda believes ex-United midfielder Paul Pogba belongs in the Premier League, not at Monaco.

I’ve seen the talk of Paul Pogba to Monaco, and I don’t think it’s the right move for him. I think Chelsea needs an experienced player, and Pogba has won the World Cup and the Europa League and knows the Premier League so well.
I think he belongs in the Premier League. Honestly, I think he belongs in the Premier League.
If he manages to get his fitness right, that is the first step. People underrate him because he has been away, but he would bring leadership.

He is hoping to lead France at the World Cup, and I think a team like Chelsea or Arsenal should try and sign him; he is a very gifted player. He has a great mindset, and he has been resilient in his career and in his private life.
He will want to get to the top, and his experience would be so valuable. All he does is overcome challenges, and with Chelsea, I think he could adjust very well to their dressing room.
Florent Malouda was speaking on behalf of bet365 and their launch of the free-to-play Club World Championship Tournament Predictor game.
Al-Hilal chief executive Esteve Calzada has remained coy over whether the Saudi Pro League club tried to sign Bruno Fernandes earlier this month.
The club's CEO told the BBC:
I cannot confirm nor deny that we've been interested in him. He's a big player; it fits the profile of player that we think would be good for Al-Hilal, just like many others.

We're not refraining from contacting players because we feel they would say no to us. The names we are linked with demonstrate the ambition of the club. We believe that we are in a position to pitch [to] any players nowadays.
The former Chelsea player Florent Malouda believes Bryan Mbeumo needs a shift of mentality to fulfil his potential and become a great player.
For Bryan Mbeumo, it's about expectation. It's a great opportunity to play for Manchester United, but at the same time, we know that the context is not favourable.

I would compare it to the situation at Real Madrid. A club with a big history, [United] still reached a European final [in the Europa League], but there are internal issues that you don't want to be involved with – you don't want to have the responsibility of fixing everything.

You want to focus on your individual performance, but that will also depend on the collective and how things are going in terms of the balance of the team. Jadon Sancho is going back, so that is another choice that might impact your performance, but Mbeumo has the potential to be a great player if he can shift his mindset.

He has been playing with not much expectation of winning trophies or competing for the Premier League; he is now about to join a big club with a big history, where it's usual to be high in the table. Mbeumo can do that, but he has to adapt his performances.
Florent Malouda was speaking on behalf of bet365 and their launch of the free-to-play Club World Championship Tournament Predictor game.
Manchester United have reportedly added Gabriel Sara 'to the transfer list' after following and watching the Galatasaray player.

Fotomac, a Turkish online sports newspaper, also credits Inter with an interest in the midfielder. His club are reputedly willing to begin negotiating at around €30million (£26million) a year after paying around half that to Norwich City for the Brazilian.
According to Football Insider, United are now in a position where they are willing to listen to offers for Mason Mount.
It is claimed that there is a possibility now that Mount could be sold despite regaining his fitness for the Reds this season.
MEN Sport has previously reported that United are willing to listen to offers for any of the players this summer.
According to Football Insider, Emiliano Martinez continues to push for an exit from Aston Villa.
The shot stopper bid an emotional farewell to the Villa fans after the last home match of the Premier League season and it is claimed his stance on an exit from Old Trafford has not changed.
Martinez thought to be a player that United are looking at despite Onana looking set to remain in Manchester.
Amid ongoing reports linking United with a move for Emi Martinez this summer, MEN Sport understands that Andre Onana is expected to stay at the club this summer.
It is believed that Onana has been working hard to convince his fellow countryman Bryan Mbeumo to sign for the Reds.
Onana is thought to have held a meeting last week with United officials where he was reassured that he shall remain at the club beyond this summer.
The new Manchester United kit is draped over the mannequins in the Old Trafford Megastore. On the online store, a handful of players' names are pre-printed on the new shirt.
Fernandes, Yoro, Martinez, Amad and Maguire are all featured. Safe choices. Ella Toone, Maya le Tissier and Grace Clinton also have that privilege.
It would be remiss of United to proactively plug 'Hojlund 9'. Get 'Rashford 10' or 'Garnacho 17' at your peril. 'Sancho' and 'Antony 21' are not even listed on the online options.
MORE HERE.
The Athletic understands that Real Betis remain keen to bring Antony to their club permanently this summer.
Talks are understood to have taken place with United to find out what their stance is. MEN Sport understands that United are keen to sell the Brazilian winger.
No offers have yet been made for Antony and there is a realisation that this one could take time to complete.
In perhaps the biggest hint yet that Garnacho will be leaving, his personal photographer Konrad Borzy appeared to confirm that the Aregentine had made his last appearances for the club.
Posting on Instagram a selection of photos of the winger in action, Borzy wrote:
One last time in Manchester United red… Garnacho under the lens.
After turning down a move to Al Hilal this summer, Galatasaray remain interested in Victor Osimhen.
The Athletic understands that Osimhen's wage demands are not a problem for the Istanbul club.
However, they would likely struggle to activate the forward's £63m release clause this summer and would need Napoli to soften their position.
Now Football Insider have claimed that United are unlikely to pursue a summer deal for Ekitke.
The 22-year-old is in high demand but the outlet has claimed that sources have told them that the price-tag for the France youngster.
The transfer mystery continues.
According to Fabrizio Romano, United have agreed a new deal for third choice goalkeeper Tom Heaton.
It is understood this news has been shared with Amorim and his coaching staff.
Heaton has reportedly signed a new one-year contract and the news will be confirmed soon.
In an interview with United We Stand, the club's CEO Omar Berrada has spoken about the potential timeline for new additions to this squad this summer.
Explaining the plan, he said:

He [Matheus Cunha] was an important one to get done. We’re going to do our best to do more signings quickly. Sometimes when you’re not quick, it’s because you’re negotiating and you’re trying to make sure you get the right value for money. So being efficient or quick isn’t necessarily the best thing for the club.
According to Sky Sport Italia, the interest in Sancho from Napoli is there but his wages could prevent a deal from happening.
The structure of a deal is currently unknown but this will apparently not stop the Naples club trying for him.
Sancho has just one year remaining on his deal at United.

headline: Manchester United's first six 2025/26 Premier League fixtures compared with top six rivals
body: For the ninth season running, Manchester United will be at home for the opening weekend of the 2025/26 Premier League campaign.

The fixtures for the forthcoming season were released on Wednesday morning and United will face Arsenal in their opening game of the 2025/26 season at Old Trafford. The contest will take place on Sunday, August 17, kick-off 4.30pm.

United have been handed a tough start to the campaign, facing Arsenal, Chelsea and Manchester City in their opening five games, meaning Ruben Amorim's troops will face several stern tests at the beginning of their first full season under the Portuguese chief's stewardship.
With the fixtures having been released, MEN Sport has had a look at United's opening six games and compared them with those of their traditional big-six rivals:

Verdict: United have been handed a testing start to the 2025/26 campaign, with their opening day assignment against the Gunners ranking as one of the most difficult opening fixtures they could have been given.

A trip to Craven Cottage, despite United's impressive record on the banks of the Thames in recent years, is never an easy game. The game against Burnley at Old Trafford at the end of August is the most enterprising opportunity for points in the opening six matches.

Facing Arsenal, City and Chelsea in their opening five will offer an indication of where United are at come the start of the new season. However, United do have a tendency for turning up against the Premier League's elite.
*All dates are subject to change.

headline: Six key dates to look out for after Manchester United's 2025/26 Premier League fixtures confirmed
body: Manchester United will get their 2025/26 Premier League campaign up and running with a mouthwatering opener against Arsenal at Old Trafford on Sunday, August 17.

The Premier League fixture schedule for the forthcoming season was revealed at 9am on Wednesday morning, confirming United will face the Gunners in one of the division's biggest rivalries on the opening weekend.

Following their curtain-raiser against the Gunners, United will complete the opening month of the season with a trip to Fulham before facing newly-promoted Burnley at Old Trafford the following weekend. They will then travel to the Etihad Stadium to face Manchester City in just their fourth game of the season.
With the fixtures now out in the open, MEN Sport has picked out six key dates you should add to your diary ahead of the 2025/26 campaign:

United will get their Premier League campaign under way against rivals Arsenal on Sunday, August 17. The TV selections for the opening weekend of the campaign have been confirmed and the clash will kick-off at 4.30pm at Old Trafford.

For the ninth season running, United will begin their Premier League campaign on home soil, last having an opening day away trip in 2016. The Reds have won their last two opening day assignments, beating both Fulham and Wolves by a goal to nil.

United are winless in their last five Premier League clashes with the Gunners, last beating them in September 2022 at Old Trafford. On that occasion, goals from Marcus Rashford (2) and Antony sealed a 3-1 win.

The first Manchester derby of the 2025/26 campaign will take place at the Etihad Stadium immediately after the first international break of the season. It is currently penciled in for a 3pm kick-off on Saturday, September 13, although that will almost certainly change for TV purposes.

The two sides did not meet in the league until December last season, meaning the fact they will meet just four games into the new campaign is rather interesting. United won at the Etihad last term, coming from being to seal a very late 2-1 win.
It will be the earliest they have met in a Premier League campaign since City beat United 2-1 at Old Trafford in September 2016.

United and Liverpool will meet for the first time in 2025/26 immediately after the October international break, with the Reds scheduled to travel to Anfield on Saturday, October 18 for a 3pm kick-off.

United produced one of their best performances of last season at Anfield, contributing to a very entertaining 2-2 draw after fears they would be beaten by the runaway Premier League leaders, who did their best to get the game on after snow had fallen.

The return meeting between the two teams at Old Trafford will not take place until May, marking United's penultimate home game of the season. The contest is currently scheduled for a 3pm kick-off on Saturday, May 2.

For the traditionalists, the Premier League fixture list will be frowned upon amid the absence of a Boxing Day schedule for 2025/26. Instead, the traditional Boxing Day round will take place on Saturday, December 27 with United welcoming Newcastle United to Old Trafford.

Prior to facing Newcastle, the Reds will face Aston Villa at Villa Park in their final game before Christmas on Saturday, December 20. United will face Wolves at Old Trafford in their final game of 2025 on Tuesday, December 30 ahead of facing Leeds United at Elland Road on Saturday, January 3.
United and City will meet for a second time in the Premier League in 2025/26 on Saturday, January 17, kick-off 3pm. However, the date and kick-off time could well be changed.

The two sides have not met in the month of January since United came from behind to win 2-1 at Old Trafford in 2023, thanks to goals from Bruno Fernandes and Marcus Rashford. That also marked United's last win over their rivals on home soil.
Last season, United and City served up a forgettable goalless draw at Old Trafford in April.

For the second time in three seasons, United will conclude the 2025/26 Premier League campaign with a trip to the Amex Stadium to face Brighton & Hove Albion on Sunday, May 24. As per Premier League tradition, all ten games will kick-off at the same time (4pm).

United concluded their 2023/24 campaign against the Seagulls at the Amex, winning 2-0 via goals from Diogo Dalot and Rasmus Hojlund. It meant they went into the following weekend's FA Cup final with a spring in their step.
United have won their last three final day fixtures, beating Fulham in 2023, Brighton in 2024 and most recently Aston Villa last month.

headline: When do Manchester United play Leeds and Liverpool in 2025/26 Premier League season?
body: Leeds United's promotion to the Premier League means Manchester United have another couple of important dates to look out for in this season's Premier League.
The fixture schedule for the 2025/26 Premier League season was released on Wednesday morning, with United facing a daunting start as they play three of the top six in their first five outings.

Along with the Manchester derby, United's clashes with Liverpool are always among the first dates fans look out for when the fixtures are released. Ruben Amorim's men travel to Anfield on October 18 before the reverse fixture at Old Trafford on May 2.

With Leeds now back in the top flight, United have another couple of games against one of their rivals to look forward to. They travel to Elland Road on January 3 before a home clash with their arch rivals on April 11.
All dates are subject to change and there's a good chance these fixtures could be moved for television coverage given the rivalry between the teams.

headline: When Manchester United and Man City will play each other in 2025/26 Premier League season
body: Manchester City and Manchester United will go head-to-head as early as the fourth game of the 2025/26 Premier League season.
City will welcome United to the Etihad Stadium immediately after the September international break. The contest is currently scheduled to take place on Saturday, September 13, kick-off 3pm.
However, with only the broadcast selections for the opening weekend of the season being confirmed thus far, the fixture date and kick-off time are almost guaranteed to be changed.

Last season, the first Manchester derby of the season in the league did not take place until mid-December with United staging a late comeback to win 2-1 at the Etihad, courtesy of goals from Bruno Fernandes and Amad. City had been in front at half-time via a Josko Gvardiol header.

The second all-Manchester affair of the campaign will take place at Old Trafford in mid-January with the showdown currently set for Saturday, January 17, kick-off 3pm. Again, that is highly likely to be changed for TV purposes.

United and City last met at Old Trafford in April and served up a forgettable goalless draw. Neither side did enough to deserve all three points in a game that will have already been forgotten by most.

The two sides faced each other three times in total last season, first meeting at Wembley in the Community Shield in August after United won the 2024 FA Cup final and City won the 2023/24 Premier League title.

Despite United taking the lead through Alejandro Garnacho, City fought back to force the game to penalties and won 7-6 on spot-kicks. In 90 minutes, though, United are unbeaten in their last four meetings against their neighbours.
*Fixture dates and kick-off times are subject to change.

headline: Manchester United's Christmas and New Year schedule as 2025/26 Premier League fixtures revealed
body: Manchester United will face Newcastle United at Old Trafford in their closest Premier League game to Christmas next season, it has been confirmed.

The Premier League revealed the fixture schedule for the 2025/26 campaign at 9am on Wednesday morning. The games after Christmas Day are currently scheduled for Saturday, 27 December, though some will likely be moved to Boxing Day once TV selections have been made. All ten fixtures scheduled for December 27 are currently down for 3pm kick-offs.
For the second season running, United will now face Eddie Howe's team towards the very end of the calendar year, with Newcastle winning 2-0 at Old Trafford in the final game of 2024 last season.

Elsewhere over the Christmas and New Year period, United will face Aston Villa at Villa Park on Saturday, December 20, kick-off 3pm, before welcoming Wolves to Old Trafford for their final game of 2025 on Tuesday, December 30 for an 8pm kick-off.
United will start 2026 with a trip to Yorkshire to face Leeds United at Elland Road on Saturday, January 3, kick-off 3pm. Again, the fixture date and kick-off time could be altered for TV.
*Fixtures are subject to change.

headline: Full Manchester United fixture list for 2025/26 Premier League season

The Premier League released the dates of all 380 fixtures for the forthcoming campaign at 9am on Wednesday morning, confirming defending champions Liverpool will face Bournemouth in the opening game of the season on Friday, August 15.

After facing Arsenal in a mouthwatering opener, United will travel to the capital the following weekend to face Fulham at Craven Cottage. The Reds will round off the opening month of the season with a home game against Burnley on Saturday, August 30 before facing Manchester City at the Etihad Stadium in their opening game of September.

headline: Man United can consider wildcard £30m transfer to solve striker search - but there's a catch
body: If this summer's transfer window has already taught us anything, it's that signing a striker is not going to be an easy task for Manchester United.
After seeing top target Liam Delap join Chelsea, United have been left with no choice but to explore alternative avenues in their hunt for a goal-getter.

Delap, despite not being the proven and established No.9 United are in such desperate need of this summer, was an attainable target due to the £30million release clause that had been inserted into his Ipswich Town contract following his arrival from Manchester City last summer.
Delap scored 12 goals in his first full season as a Premier League striker and was not light on suitors as a result. His release clause and his potential made him an attractive option.
However, it goes without saying that United need a proven goalscorer this summer. They gambled on potential with Rasmus Hojlund in 2023 and did exactly the same with Joshua Zirkzee last year.

Neither player arrived at Old Trafford with a proven goalscoring record and that is why United are in such desperate need of an established goalscorer for the third summer transfer window running. However, securing a proven goalscorer is an easier said than done task.

United have been linked with a flurry of strikers in recent weeks, both domestically and abroad, including Jean-Philippe Mateta of Crystal Palace, Sporting Lisbon star Viktor Gyokeres, Napoli's Victor Osimhen and soon-to-be free agent Jonathan David.

Having already signed Matheus Cunha from Wolves for £62.5m and remaining hopeful of signing Brentford ace Bryan Mbeumo for a potentially similar fee, United do not have a bottomless pit to turn to this summer in their quest to sign a No.9, meaning they may have no choice but to distance themselves from the more premium and luxurious names.

Sporting want top dollar for Gyokeres, who has reportedly chosen Arsenal as his preferred destination, and Osimhen has set eye-watering wage demands. With that said, United may have to look further afield in their search for a centre-forward, and one name they could consider adding to their shortlist is Atletico Madrid striker Alexander Sorloth.

The Norwegian, once of Palace, joined Atletico from La Liga counterparts Villarreal just under a year ago for a fee reportedly in the region of £30m and scored 24 goals in his debut season at the Metropolitano Stadium, meaning he has netted 50 goals in the last two seasons.

Having scored 24 goals for Atletico in 2024/25, the idea of them selling the 29-year-old and for a reasonable price may feel somewhat fanciful. However, the Spanish outfit's attacking options also consist of Julian Alvarez, Antoine Griezmann and Angel Correa, meaning they are not short on options.

Despite ending the season as Atletico's second highest goalscorer, only coming second to Alvarez, who netted 29, Sorloth did not play as prominent a role as he would have liked. Of his 35 La Liga appearances, 20 of them were via the bench.

Despite proving to be effective as an impact player, scoring 12 league goals after coming off the bench, Sorloth will believe his exploits in front of goal would have been worthy of more opportunities as a starter. There is a chance he could become increasingly frustrated if he continues to be utilised as an impact substitute by Atletico boss Diego Simeone.

At United, he would be a guaranteed starter amid their need for a goalscorer. After a disappointing stint at Palace between 2018 and 2020, the Norwegian has found his feet in Spain, scoring 74 goals in 182 games for Real Sociedad, Villarreal and Atletico combined.
His record is by no means as impressive as Gyokeres' or Osimhen's, for example, but few would categorise him alongside those two as being among Europe's elite strikers.
Manchester United have launched their new home kit for the 2025/26 season with an Adidas shirt paying tribute to Old Trafford.
Fans can order their Men's, Women's and Kid's shirt today.

Nevertheless, his haul of 66 goals over the last three seasons is worthy of recognition. The elephant in the room is that he failed to cut it in England with Palace, scoring just once in 20 appearances, but he has developed and matured since arriving at Selhurst Park as a 22-year-old in 2018.
With Cunha already in situ and Mbeumo being targeted, they would be able to help ease the burden on Sorloth and assist with United's attacking output.
With no obvious answer to United's striker search currently available, Sorloth could be a suitable fit if the price is right.

headline: Manchester United 'join transfer race' for £42m star as Liverpool talks opened
body: Manchester United are reported to have joined the race to sign Lyon star Malick Fofana.
United have already made one new signing this summer, with Matheus Cunha arriving from Wolves after the club paid the £62.5million release clause in his contract.
Now plans will be well underway for further new additions to be made to Ruben Amorim's squad over the next couple of months.

The summer transfer window runs until September 1, which gives United plenty of time to get deals over the line. Fofana has become the latest name mentioned on the United transfer rumour mill as a potential target.
French news outlet L'Equipe have reported that United have entered the race to sign Fofana this summer and have expressed an interest in bringing the 20-year-old to Old Trafford.
Chelsea have been mentioned in the report as making an approach to Lyon about the possibility of signing Fofana, although no offer has been made for the Belgium international.
Liverpool are also mentioned in the report alongside United as showing an interest in Fofana. It is claimed the Premier League champions have opened talks with the player's representatives.

Lyon are reported to value Fofana at a fee greater than €50million (£42.7million). It has been speculated that there is a chance the forward will not be in attendance for Lyon's first day of pre-season training on July 7, due to reported interest from English clubs.
Fofana enjoyed an impressive season for Lyon last term, scoring 11 goals in all competitions.

The forward missed the first leg of the Europa League quarter-final against United with injury, but featured in the reverse fixture at Old Trafford and provided an assist as United ran out 5-4 winners on the night.

headline: Matheus Cunha has already shown he can prove Omar Berrada right at Manchester United
body: New Manchester United recruit Matheus Cunha has already hinted that being granted freedom will be the key to him making a name for himself at Old Trafford.
The Brazilian international finalised his move to M16 last week after United triggered his £62.5million release clause earlier this month. He has joined from Wolves on a five-year deal.
Cunha is expected to add goals and creativity to United's attack after plundering an impressive 17 goals for Wolves in 2024/25.
The 26-year-old will have aspirations of making an immediate impact in his debut season at Old Trafford. He is expected to occupy the left-sided No.10 role in Ruben Amorim's trademark 3-4-2-1 system.
Well-versed in a three-at-the-back formation, Cunha should be able to adapt to Amorim's methods and demands relatively comfortably. He is a specialist No.10 and is capable of making things happen.
In his first interview as a United player that was released last Friday, Cunha opened up on how former Wolves boss Gary O'Neil's advice improved him as a player.
Cunha said: "At the time we changed the manager, he came in and told me, 'Matheus, I can only say to you, be a little bit more free'. He gave me all the confidence to play well.

"It was a little bit easier because I did well last season, 14 goals. I think I did this only because he came and said to me to be free, show yourself. They were important words for me. Coming from Atletico was a little bit hard."

In charge at Molineux between August 2023 and December 2024, O'Neil got a consistent tune out of Cunha, with the former Atletico Madrid forward scoring 22 goals and registering 12 assists in 55 appearances under the 42-year-old.
O'Neil's successor, Vitor Pereira, also managed to get the best out of Cunha, who scored nine goals and claimed three assists in 19 matches under his management.

Establishing himself as a creative force, who thrives of both scoring and creating goals, it is hardly surprising United chief executive Omar Berrada is confident Cunha will be a player that gets United's supporters out of their seats.
"He's a player that I think fans are going to love," Berrada told United We Stand. "We can talk about his technical abilities and he can play in three different positions.
"He's a playmaking attacking midfielder; he can score goals, he can make assists. I think he's going to lift people off their seats.
"He's got a bit of a swagger about him that people are going to really like. Dare I say, Cantona-esque."

With Berrada hopeful Cunha will bring entertainment to Old Trafford, the attacker's comments about how O'Neil took him to a different level by allowing him to play with the shackles off should offer an insight to Amorim on how to get the best out of him.
Cunha is expected to occupy the left-sided playmaker spot and it will be from that role he will be determined to express himself and pick up from where he left off at Molineux.

headline: Viktor Gyokeres to Man United transfer latest as wage demands emerge and decision made
body: The wage demands of Manchester United-linked striker Viktor Gyokeres have reportedly been revealed, though only because Juventus have burst onto the scene and are said to be well on their way to making an offer.

Amid Ruben Amorim's search for a new striker to spearhead his United side, the speculation of a reunion with a familiar face has been incessant. Gyokeres was the scorer of 66 goals under the manager during 15 months together at Sporting CP, so the logic would be he resumes such a record at Old Trafford.
But the process around the striker's exit has not been a simple one with 'fury' from the player himself over the actions of his club president, who had a frosty back-and-forth with his agent.
Ultimately we are now said to be beyond that stage, and Sporting are ready to accept their No.9's move on the terms of a 'gentleman's agreement' below his €100m (£84m).
Whilst Premier League rivals Arsenal have been the other team most-talked about at this stage, Corriere dello Sport now suggest Juventus are the new threat to watch out for.
They explain how The Old Lady have seven players on their roster ready to be sold, including striker Dusan Vlahovic and midfielder Douglas Luiz. For that duo alone they wish to recoup €60m (£51m).
They can then launch an €80m (£68m) offensive for Gyokeres, made up of a €70m (£59m) up front fee and €10m (£9m) worth of add-on bonuses.
It is described as a 'complex web', but one 'worth weaving' due to the Sweden international's return of 97 goals over the past two seasons.
Helping their cause has also been the past sales of Wojceich Szczesny, Federico Chiesa, Arthur Melo, Mattia De Sciglio and Tiago Djalo - all freeing up essential funds from Juve's wage bill.

Their extra sales this summer means even more will be available, with the Italian publication adding that they will then be able to meet Gyokeres' expectation to earn €7.5m (£6.3m) per year as a player in Turin.
That would equate to €145k (£120k) per week, and gives United their first indicator as how much Gyokeres may set them back in addition to the transfer fee involved.
Scandinavian publication FotbollSkanalen add this would be a huge increase on the €2m (£1.7m) the 27-year-old takes home per year at Sporting.
Finally, clearing up some discrepancies around the sell-on clause involved in the deal are Portuguese outlet A Bola.
They understand that Sporting initially agreed to hand over 15 percent of their earnings from the future sale of Gyokeres to his former club, Championship club Coventry City.

Last summer that dropped to 10 percent and although there were some reports that Coventry no longer had that agreement in play, they say it is still active and they still stand to make a 'significant' amount from the impending transfer.
Meanwhile, Real Madrid are said to have turned down the chance to sign Gyokeres. According to The Athletic, Gyokeres was proposed to Real as they search for a new centre forward.
But Los Blancos have decided against making a move. It's added that while Xabi Alonso's side 'like him', they ruled him out because of the potential cost and his demand to be a starter.
United have already signed Matheus Cunha to boost Amorim's squad, with the club also hopeful of completing a deal for Bryan Mbeumo.

headline: Jadon Sancho Man United transfer exit latest as new escape route 'opens'
body: Manchester United winger Jadon Sancho is reportedly a target for Serie A champions Napoli this summer transfer window.

The Naples club, who signed Scott McTominay from United last summer in a deal that has been hailed as a success, are believed to be looking at Sancho to continue the Old Trafford connection. Sancho spent last season on loan at Chelsea and while he scored in the Conference League final against Real Betis, the winger's time at Stamford Bridge was largely considered underwhelming.

At the end of this season, it was no surprise to see Sancho and Chelsea fail to reach personal terms on a new contract. Despite being obligated to purchase the 25-year-old, the Blues agreed to pay United £5m to allow him to return to Old Trafford.

This was seen as bad news for United who are keen to sell Sancho permanently this summer and now face the task of finding him a new home. Fortunately, an escape route to Italy has opened for the winger with journalist Gianluca di Marzio insisting that Napoli are interested in the England international.

Napoli lost Khvicha Kvaratskhelia to PSG in the January transfer window and were unable to sign a replacement then as United rejected a bid for Alejandro Garnacho. It now seems that his teammate is an option for Antonio Conte albeit there is reportedly a hurdle for that signature.

Sky Sport Italia echoes the news that Napoli want to sign Sancho this summer, however, there are concerns about whether they can offer him the wage that he desires. Despite this, it is insisted that they are willing to give it a go for the winger who has just one year remaining on his deal at United.

headline: Ruben Amorim 'arguments' at training ground with Man United star who's set to be sold
body: Alejandro Garnacho has been given a stark warning to prioritise his football over disagreements with his boss.

The 20-year-old is expected to leave Manchester United this summer after reportedly being told he can seek a new club. The situation surrounding the young winger has become more intense amidst claims of a fallout with United head coach Ruben Amorim at the end of the season.
Napoli had a £40million bid for the player rejected in January, highlighting his value to the club. However, it's thought a £70m approach would be enough to secure his exit.

As Garnacho inches closer to leaving Old Trafford, former Liverpool forward Dean Saunders explained how he had heard about disagreements between the player and Amorim, as they were said to have rowed about tactics at United's training ground.

The former Wrexham and Wolves boss criticised the player's choice to confront his head coach, while also expressing admiration for his playing ability. However, Garnacho's character is something that certainly bothers Saunders.

Speaking on talkSPORT, Saunders said: "I like him as a player. He plays with his heart on his sleeve, and there's a load of them who don't at Man United. But from a good source, I heard he's arguing with the manager on the training pitch about tactics. How old is he, 20? Just get on with it."

The focus at United this summer is very much on making squad improvements, with Amorim already welcoming Matheus Cunha in a £62.5million deal. Brentford's Bryan Mbeumo is also very much being hunted, despite Thomas Frank's desire to lure him to Tottenham.
Saunders has warned United that focusing on players' mentalities is key when making future signings, following Amorim's well-publicised rows with Garnacho and Marcus Rashford this season.

He added: "Man United have signed bad characters, and you've got to start signing good characters. Forget the talent. Obviously, you've got to have a certain amount to play at the level you're at, but they've got to concentrate on signing good characters, because they're shambolic at the moment."

Garnacho has expressed a desire to remain in the UK if he leaves United this summer. Chelsea are understood to be leading the chase, with Arsenal and Aston Villa among the others reportedly interested.

His former club Atletico Madrid are also eyeing a move, alongside Bayer Leverkusen, who recently appointed Erik ten Hag as their new manager. Any transfer fee for Garnacho would mean pure profit for United as a result of his status as a homegrown talent.

headline: Manchester United 'agree deal' after confirming new contract talks
body: Manchester United have apparently made a decision on Tom Heaton's future at the club.
United are in the middle of planning for the 2025/26 season, with the summer transfer window dominating the headlines.
One new signing has already been confirmed by United, with Matheus Cunha arriving in a £62.5 million deal from Wolves.
It's not just new arrivals that United will be focused on this summer, but also players already at the club.
Whether that be agreeing new contracts or exploring deals for players to leave, United are already having a busy summer.

Heaton is one player who has been rumoured to be heading for the exit door this summer. The goalkeeper's contract is set to expire at the end of the month, meaning he is just weeks away from becoming a free agent.
United confirmed when they announced their retained list that they were in talks with Heaton over a potential extension.
Now a fresh update has emerged about the 39-year-old's future as the end of June fast approaches.
Fabrizio Romano has reported on X, formerly known as Twitter, that United have agreed a deal for Heaton to extend his contract at Old Trafford.
The report claims that the agreement will see United extend Heaton's deal by 12 months until the summer of 2026, meaning he would no longer be leaving the club for free on June 30.
United signed Heaton in the summer of 2021 and the shot-stopper has become a valuable member of the dressing room despite making only three appearances for the club over the last four years.
The last time Heaton played for United's first team was in February 2023 in a Carabao Cup semi-final victory over Nottingham Forest.

headline: Viktor Gyokeres to Man United transfer twist as Real Madrid make decision after 'offer'
body: Manchester United have been dealt a boost in the race for Viktor Gyokeres after Real Madrid rejected the chance to sign the Sporting CP forward.
Gyokeres, 27, has emerged as a summer target for Ruben Amorim's side following an excellent season at Sporting, where he plundered 54 goals in 52 matches in all competitions.
United are intent on signing a new No.9 to boost the club's attack this summer and Gyokeres is near the top of their shopping list, having worked with Amorim during their time together at Sporting.

However, it has now appeared that Gyokeres has been offered to another team. According to The Athletic, the former Coventry City man has been proposed to Real Madrid as they search for a new centre forward.

But Los Blancos have said 'no' and turned down the chance to sign Gyokeres. It's added that while Xabi Alonso's side 'like him', they ruled him out because of the potential cost and his demand to be a starter.

The Spanish giants are instead in the market for a Joselu-type centre forward: a player who can make an impact in the box, could be signed for a low fee and would accept a back-up role to Kylian Mbappe.
21-year-old forward Gonzalo Garcia, who is from the club's reserve team in the Spanish third division, is expected to be used as their second-choice striker behind Mbappe at the Club World Cup.

As for Gyokeres, he is still expected to leave Sporting and seek a new adventure, almost a week on since the club's president revealed that there is no gentleman's agreement for him to leave for £59million.
"I can guarantee that Viktor Gyokeres will not leave for 60m euros plus 10m euros because I never promised that," Frederico Varandas said in a press conference last Wednesday.
"To this day Sporting has not had an offer for Gyokeres - neither today nor last season."

Reports in Portugal suggested that Gyokeres was left feeling 'disrespected' about the situation and won't return to Sporting for pre-season. It was added that the Swede would 'rather go on strike' and is willing to 'interrupt his vacation' to speak out about his situation and Sporting's agreement that was in place.

Speaking last month, Sporting vice-president Francisco Salgado Zenha provided an update on Gyokeres' future and revealed the club are hoping to keep hold of him. He said: "He has three more years on his contract. At the moment there are no offers, he has three more years on his contract.
"I think the answer has been given. [Sporting's transfer plans] won’t be any different from last year. We want to keep the best players and retain talent.

"We want to continue to be champions, have competitive teams and fight on all fronts. I have been in this role for seven years. In the years when Sporting were champions, we even made fewer sales than in other years... the fact that we are champions gives us a greater ability to retain players and talent.
"Coincidence or not, we have not had to sell any players in those times. Not that we have not received offers, but the market is not under our control, we are always dependent."

headline: Man Utd vs Arsenal tickets already on sale for blockbuster Premier League opener
body: The Premier League fixture computer has delivered a massive opening weekend of football and there are none bigger than Arsenal’s visit to Manchester United.

General sale for the game will not take place for another few weeks but just minutes after the fixture was confirmed, official hospitality seller Seat Unique had listed tickets for the match on their site.

Tickets start from £299 per seat and get you a padded seat in one of the hospitality areas of the ground, a meal deal and a match day programme. The tickets are on sale and can be upgraded to the £449 ‘International Lounge’ seats that include a complimentary bar and two hours of post-match hospitality.

The tickets are some of the cheapest available on the opening weekend of the Premier League season. Liverpool’s home game against Bournemouth on Friday 17 August will cost from £449 for Anfield hospitality, while Arsenal’s opening home game of the season the following week against Leeds starts from £549 for hospitality tickets.
Everton’s first home game against Brighton are some of the most expensive in the league with prices starting at £595 for the historic game.

Cheaper tickets will be available for all Premier League games but fans will have to enter club ballots and general sales in the hope of securing a more affordable seat for the new Premier League season.
Aston Villa will play Newcastle in the early Saturday kick-off on the opening Premier League weekend, while Brighton face Fulham and Forest will take on Brentford at 3pm.
Sunderland versus West Ham and Spurs versus Burnley complete the non-televised fixtures and Wolves against Manchester City will be the late Saturday game.
Chelsea versus Crystal Palace will be the first game on Super Sunday and Leeds will host Everton will be the weekend’s final game on Monday night.

headline: Transfer rumour power ranking: Two new Man Utd links, Arsenal feign surprise over Sesko
body: Arsenal’s pursuit of Benjamin Sesko is stalling after the Gunners learned something they definitely already knew, while Man Utd are being used again…
With so much transfer talk doing the rounds, we’re here through the summer to sift through the bullsh*t and highlight the whispers that might have some substance.
Each day we’re ranking the top 20 rumours involving Premier League clubs, the higher the link, the more likely we feel they are to becoming done deals.
So we start with the tittle-tattle…

20) 🆕 Callum Hudson-Odoi – Nottingham Forest to Manchester United
The story goes that Forest have opened talks over a new deal for Hudson-Odoi while Roma, Napoli and United hover. All very convenient for his agent, that.

19) 🆕 Jadon Sancho – Manchester United to Napoli
We almost want this to happen just to see Antonio Conte’s head fall off by Christmas. We’re told Napoli have £45million to spend on a winger, but they have a couple of better options in Manchester. More specifically, they have a better option in the United cast-off bin. And if Chelsea wouldn’t pay Sancho’s wages, an amount he is due for another year from United, then the ex-England winger has no hope of getting such a salary from Napoli. And reports suggest he has no intention of lowering his demands. Another loan beckons.

18) Antoine Semenyo – Bournemouth to Manchester United
Tottenham were linked with the Bournemouth attacker and now United apparently have him in their sights if Mbeumo chooses a reunion with Thomas Frank at Spurs. Eberechi Eze is also an alternative target. This is a long way from being a thing.

16) Rodrygo – Real Madrid to Arsenal
With Nico Williams preferring to join Barcelona, the Arsenal-Rodrygo links are resurfacing, The Brazilian is at the Club World Cup with Real Madrid but the Gunners’ interest is ‘genuine’ and ‘exploratory talks’ have taken place.

MORE ON THE SUMMER 2025 TRANSFER WINDOW
👉 Every Premier League transfer and release confirmed in the summer of 2025
👉 Twenty biggest transfers in the world in 2025 summer transfer window
👉 Wirtz next? The last five times every Premier League club broke transfer record

15) 🔽 Viktor Gyokeres – Sporting to Manchester United
There was a report from Record in Portugal that Gyokeres had told United he wasn’t interested, but others dispute that claim. Either way, it seems to us that the Swede is holding out for Arsenal. If the Gunners go a different way, then United might be in. But then they have to deal with Sporting, who deny they ever agreed to sell for £59million.

14) Jack Grealish – Manchester City to Napoli
Apparently, Napoli have £45million to spend on a left winger, with Grealish and Alejandro Garnacho in the frame. City value Grealish at £50million, which is a much smaller gap to bridge than United’s hopeless demand of £70million for Garnacho. Grealish in Naples? Yes please.

13) 🆕 Dusan Vlahovic – Juventus to Manchester United
The Serbia striker, linked with Arsenal since the womb, has apparently approached United directly because he fancies a move to Old Trafford. United, for their part, are quite receptive, especially having learned Vlahovic would cost just shy of £40million, which is less than Gyokeres. Keep an eye on this one.

12) Joao Pedro – Brighton to Newcastle
The Seagulls forward is intent on leaving Brighton to take the next step but apparently, wherever he goes, he wants to be the first choice. Which won’t happen at Newcastle for as long as Alexander Isak is around. So what does it say about Isak’s future that Newcastle are about to enter talks to bring Pedro from the south coast to the North East? If that is the Magpies’ intention, they will have to get around Brighton’s £60million valuation and the fact that the Brazilian’s mate says he wants to live in London. Hide all the maps, lads.
MORE: Top 10 wingers available this summer features Arsenal, Liverpool targets and Man Utd outcast

11) Victor Osimhen – Napoli to Liverpool
Apparently, Liverpool are looking to offer Darwin Nunez and Federico Chiesa to Napoli in exchange for the Nigeria striker. Which actually makes sense. We know Napoli like Nunez, who would either be a huge hit or a massive flop in Naples – there’s no middle ground. Swap deals don’t happen anymore – unless they a PSR tickle – but this could actually work, if there’s any truth in it.

10) 🔽 Benjamin Sesko – RB Leipzig to Arsenal
There was talk of Arsenal submitting a serious bid this week, but they are reluctant to meet Leipzig’s valuation, which falls somewhere between £68milion and £85million. Which was always going to be around the going rate for a top centre-forward this summer. The Gunners are trying to keep their options open, which can only take them so far. Especially while Bayern Munich eye Sesko as a potential successor to Harry Kane.

9) 🔼 Son Heung-min – Tottenham to Saudi Arabia
It was widely reported that Spurs are ready to sell their skipper, but only after they have milked for every last penny by parading him on pre-season tour in his homeland. Levy, that. Apparently, Al-Ahli, Al-Nassr and Al-Qadsiah are all prepared to pay £34million for Son, who is entering the final year of his contract at Spurs.

8) 🔼 Andy Robertson – Liverpool to Atletico Madrid
This appears to be gathering pace rather quickly. Atletico Madrid have made a cheeky request to secure their ‘dream’ signing. We can see A-Rob being right up Diego Simeone’s street.

7) Bryan Mbeumo – Brentford to Tottenham
All Spurs had to do to pique Mbeumo’s intrigue was sack the manager and appoint the Cameroonian’s old one. Thomas Frank’s appointment has, apparently, opened Mbeumo’s mind to the possibility of joining Tottenham. But he did seem pretty determined to join the Man Utd circus.

6) 🔼 Viktor Gyokeres – Sporting Lisbon to Arsenal
Arsenal are still keeping both Gyokeres and Sesko dangling, getting as far as they can with both before they have to make a decision either way. It’s a dangerous game, especially while both attract interest from elsewhere and players like to feel wanted. The Gunners will get no discount on either. Right now, there seems to be a little more noise around Sesko, but that could quickly change with the wind.

5) Bryan Mbeumo – Brentford to Manchester United
Mbeumo is giving mixed signals. At first he only had eyes for United but Thomas Frank’s appointment has given Spurs renewed hope. If nothing else, it should prompt United into decisive action in the form of a second offer, though they would ‘abandon’ a move on one condition.

4) Martin Zubimendi – Real Sociedad to Arsenal
This one got the ‘Here we go’ treatment well over a month ago but then it all went a bit quiet. And then there was talk of Real Madrid sticking their nose in. Fear not, though, Gooners. Ornstein said it’s done. But still we wait.

3) Milos Kerkez – Bournemouth to Liverpool
It’s happening, apparently. For around £40million. Which represents decent business for both sides. Things have gone a little quiet since while Liverpool pursue Wirtz but seemingly there is nothing or Reds to worry about here. The fact Bournemouth have now signed a replacement suggests this will get moving again very soon.

2) Sverre Nypan – Rosenborg to Manchester City
Arsenal fancied their chances of landing the Norwegian wonderkid, and Villa were in talks in recent months. But City are in the mood for signings and it looks like they have agreed a £12.5million deal for the 18-year-old attacking midfielder. A medical is scheduled for Monday, so we’re told.

1) Florian Wirtz – Bayer Leverkusen to Liverpool
Liverpool will reportedly pay a British record £116.9m for Wirtz. That’s a lot of wonga for everyone to get very worked up about. Regardless, we are now at the point of arranging a medical, which is set for Friday, apparently. Stand by your flight trackers, Reds.

headline: Premier League tickets loophole sees fans get opening-day seats early
body: Fans who want to get early tickets to the opening weekend of the Premier League season face prices of up to £1,000 or face a gamble in the ticket ballots.
The Premier League is the most popular in the world and stadiums across the country are expected to be completely sold out on the opening weekend of the 2025/26 season.

While some fans will have to wait for the club’s own ticket sales and ballots for seats, fans who want to pay more can secure tickets to the biggest games of the opening weekend from 9am thanks to a new official VIP and hospitality seller.
Seat Unique are selling tickets to every Premier League opening game of the season at 9am today (Wednesday 18 June) including tickets at the likes of Anfield, Old Trafford and the Emirates.
Liverpool open the season on Friday night against Bournemouth and tickets are on sale already for £449 for Anfield’s hospitality lounges.

Seat Unique has secured rights to sell lounges, VIP seats and hospitality for many Premier League grounds and prices start from around £70 up to four-figure seats in hospitality areas offering food, drinks and entertainment. You can see all of the tickets here.
The league’s top clubs have already introduced ballots to give fans a chance to get tickets for the new season and fans are only able to enter them if they sign up for a club membership package.

Arsenal hold ballots for every home game for club members, with tens of thousands of fans scrambling for tickets. Liverpool hold sales twice a season with the first coming in July for games in the first half of the season.

Manchester United, Spurs and Newcastle all hold ticket sales for members with demand drastically outstripping supply and Everton have released new membership options for fans who want to visit the league’s newest stadium as they move into their new home at Bramley Moore Dock.

headline: Premier League 2025/26 fixtures: Man Utd vs Arsenal on opening weekend with full list announced
body: We are craving the return of proper football as the Club World Cup, a tournament no one really cares about, is not sufficient and don’t get us started on Soccer Aid.
Thankfully, the return of Premier League football is gradually edging closer, with two months to go until the opening weekend of the 2025/26 campaign, from August 16th to 18th.

The next marathon of a 38-game season culminates on Sunday, May 24, and as always, much is to be decided before we get there and the 20 Premier League teams have learned who they face on the opening weekend.
👉 FOR A FULL BREAKDOWN OF THE 25/26 PL CALENDAR, HEAD TO OUR FIXTURES PAGE… 👈
The pick of the first set of matches takes place at Old Trafford as Man Utd face Arsenal (you can buy tickets already), while champions Liverpool are also at home as they face Bournemouth.

Amorim will be under immense pressure to have a good start to next season, but Opta reckon the Red Devils have the toughest set of opening five fixtures as they also face Manchester City and Chelsea in the first few weeks of the campaign. Gulp.
Arsenal will not be too happy about their start either, facing Leeds United, Liverpool, Nottingham Forest, Man City and Newcastle United after Man Utd on the opening weekend.
READ: Liverpool signings mean 25/26 title in bag as Man City ‘gutting team of leaders’
The full list of opening day fixtures are as follows:
Friday, August 15: Liverpool vs Bournemouth – 8pm.
Saturday, August 16: Aston Villa vs Newcastle United – 12.30pm
Saturday, August 16: Brighton vs Fulham – 3pm
Saturday, August 16: Nottingham Forest vs Brentford – 3pm
Saturday, August 16: Sunderland vs West Ham United – 3pm
Saturday, August 16: Tottenham Hotspur vs Burnley – 3pm
Saturday, August 16: Wolverhampton vs Manchester City – 5.30pm.
Sunday, August 17: Chelsea vs Crystal Palace – 2pm.
Sunday, August 17: Manchester United vs Arsenal – 4pm.
Monday, August 18: Leeds United vs Everton
There are currently no scheduled Boxing Day matches, but the Premier League have insisted that games can be moved to December 26 from December 27 to be televised.

A statement read: “In keeping with our commitment to providing a greater rest period over the Christmas and New Year period, no club will be requested to play less than 48 hours between Match Rounds 18 and 19 (December 27 and December 30).
“Each club has a home match on either 27 December or 3 January, with travel reduced on 27 December and 30 December.”

There are several eye-catching matches due around Christmas, with the December 27 gameweek fixtures as follows: Arsenal vs Brighton, Brentford vs Bournemouth. Burnley vs Everton, Chelsea vs Aston Villa, Crystal Palace vs Tottenham Hotspur, Liverpool vs Wolves, Man Utd vs Newcastle, Nottm Forest vs Man City, Sunderland vs Leeds and West Ham vs Fulham\
The final day’s matches have also been announced, with Liverpool and Man City at home, while Arsenal face a trip to a London rival.

The 25/26 Premier League final day: Brighton vs Man Utd, Burnley vs Wolves, Crystal Palace vs Arsenal, Fulham vs Newcastle, Liverpool vs Brentford, Man City vs Aston Villa, Nottm Forest vs Bournemouth, Sunderland vs Chelsea. Tottenham Hotspur vs Everton and West Ham vs Leeds.
